means: 公民，市民（现主要指某些欧洲国家中产阶级的市民或镇民）

sentence.Network_en: Seller unagree to allowance over 30 c burgher push undesirable.
sentence.Network_cn: 卖方拒绝赔偿30美分以上,再勉强也无用.

sentence.Network_en: The pop festival have shocked the good burgher of canterbury.
sentence.Network_cn: 流行歌曲音乐汇演震动了坎特伯雷有头有脸的市民.

sentence.Network_en: Out upon these graceless scholars who dare to address a burgher in such a manner!
sentence.Network_cn: 罪孽呀罪孽!有些学子竟这样对一个市民出言不逊!

PerfectNetExp.abs: 由此可见,在中国传统语汇之中,公民,几乎精神奴隶的另一种称呼。 当然,西方的“公民(burgher)”词汇本义,当然不是奴隶之民的意思,但是,其与中国古代的“公民”.
在中世纪的城市中“市民(burgher)”一词具有特定的历史和政治含义。它表示享有公民权的城市居民,因而市民群体就是城市的公民群体。市民的公民权赋予了他们参与城市.
(文雅的)daughter of a “good old burgher(自治市的自由民) family” Gertrude C.
burghead 伯格黑德, burgher 城市市民, burgher 伯格人

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from burgh, reinforced by Dutch burger, from burg 'castle' (see borough)

entry.tran: 市民（尤指比较富有和受人尊敬的人）
entry.def: The burghers of a town or city are the people who live there, especially the richer or more respectable people.

means.word_mean: 1. a citizen of an English borough
2. a member of the middle class

auth_sentence.content: Back in Chicago, he became a widely renowned antitrust litigator while enjoying the life of a golf-playing suburban burgher.
